high_risk_items.description: The RFP includes a Native American Preference Policy. RFQXpert is not Native American owned. Winning the bid will be challenging unless RFQXpert subcontracts with a Native American business. If RFQXpert were to fraudulently claim Native American status, it would be a severe legal violation.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Do not falsely claim Native American preference. Explore partnership or subcontracting opportunities with certified Native American businesses to fulfill preference requirements. Disclose all subcontracting arrangements. Thoroughly review the Native American Preference Policy and SRMT General Contract Terms and Conditions.

high_risk_items.description: The SRMT Corporate Compliance Policy states that successful proposers will be screened against the Department of Health & Human Services/Office of Inspector General and The System for Award Management (SAM) exclusion database. Any findings will cause the proposal to be non-responsive or will lead to contract termination if discovered after the award. RFQXpert must maintain its SAM.gov registration to avoid being excluded from eligibility for federal funds
high_risk_items.mitigation: Ensure RFQXpert maintains an active and compliant SAM.gov registration. Regularly check the company's status in SAM.gov and address any issues immediately. Conduct internal audits to proactively identify and resolve any potential compliance issues.

high_risk_items.description: The RFP includes numerous certifications (Lobbying, Debarment, Drug-Free Workplace, Trafficking in Persons, Anti-Collusion). Failure to comply with these certifications could lead to legal repercussions and contract termination.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Thoroughly review all certifications and ensure RFQXpert meets the requirements. Implement internal policies and procedures to maintain compliance. Obtain legal counsel to review certifications and compliance procedures.

high_risk_items.description: The RFP requests a firm fixed pricing structure with Net 30 payment terms. If RFQXpert underestimates the project costs, or is slow in providing deliverables it may be at risk of delivering services for less profit than expected. There is also a risk of non-payment from SRMT. The Tribal Government is tax exempt.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Conduct a comprehensive cost analysis, factoring in all potential expenses. Negotiate favorable payment terms and establish clear milestones for payment. Ensure proper invoicing procedures and maintain open communication with SRMT regarding payment schedules. Understand implications of the tribal government being tax exempt.

high_risk_items.description: The RFP requires training for Tribal program staff to maintain websites without specialized technical knowledge. This requires adequate training documentation to be provided, and the staff need to be trained to a minimum level to successfully maintain the website.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Allocate sufficient resources for training. Develop a comprehensive training program with clear documentation. Provide ongoing support to tribal staff to ensure successful website maintenance. Obtain feedback from tribal staff to improve the training program.

medium_risk_items.description: The RFP requires expertise in Craft CMS 3. If RFQXpert lacks sufficient experience or the required skills in Craft CMS 3, project delays or quality issues may arise. The RFQ also asks for ongoing website support. RFQXpert staff may become overwhelmed and may take long to respond to queries.
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Assess RFQXpert's internal expertise in Craft CMS 3. Provide additional training or hire qualified personnel if necessary. Document all development and maintenance processes. Implement an efficient system for responding to inquiries and resolving technical issues. Ensure enough internal staff can provide support.

medium_risk_items.description: The SRMT General Contract Terms and Conditions include clauses regarding indemnification, liability, and termination. Understanding the full implications of these clauses is crucial to avoid potential disputes or financial losses.
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Thoroughly review and understand all terms and conditions, particularly those related to indemnification, liability, and termination. Consult with legal counsel to clarify any ambiguous clauses. Negotiate modifications to the contract terms to mitigate potential risks.

medium_risk_items.description: The RFP mentions SRMT having the right to terminate the contract due to not meeting any or all agreement terms, and conditions. Failing to meet these terms will have impact on project completion.
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Ensure that RFQXpert meet all agreement terms and conditions, and will work towards project completion with high service quality. Follow all SRMT instructions in project deployment and consult legal counsel for advice.

low_risk_items.description: The proposal validity period is 60 calendar days. Market conditions or internal resource availability could change during this period, making the proposal outdated.
low_risk_items.mitigation: Monitor market conditions and internal resource availability during the proposal validity period. Update the proposal if necessary to reflect any significant changes. Clarify the terms of the validity period with SRMT.

low_risk_items.description: The term is one year. SRMT may not be pleased with the services provided and not renew the contract. The Tribal Government would also choose an internal supplier in the future.
low_risk_items.mitigation: Ensure the best service is provided in the one-year duration. Engage with SRMT frequently and update them on the project's deployment frequently, thus having a better engagement with their staff.
